channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-13219] LTR FieldLengthFeature causes NullPointerException with documents that do not have the requested field
item.description:
1) Create an index with a dynamic field, eg tm_my_fulltext_field based on tm_* dynamic field

2) Index your documents and make sure not all of the documents have the tm_my_fulltext_field field.

3) Set up a feature store as follows

{
"initArgs": {},
"initializedOn": "2019-01-21T21:09:59.011Z",
"updatedSinceInit": "2019-01-21T22:01:14.113Z",
"managedList": [
{
"name": "descriptionLength",
"class": "org.apache.solr.ltr.feature.FieldLengthFeature",
"params": {
"field": "tm_my_fulltext_field"
},
"store": "_DEFAULT_"
}
]
}

Try to fetch the feature in a query

 

http://localhost:8983/solr/dropsolid8/select?q=europe&json.nl=flat&omitHeader=true&fl=ss_search_api_id,ss_search_api_language,hash,[features]&start=0&rows=10&wt=json&rq={!ltr efi.query=europe model=originalScoreModel}}&df=tm_X3b_nl_rendered_item

You'll see

 

2019-02-05 13:45:36.087 ERROR (qtp690521419-21) [ x:dropsolid8] o.a.s.h.RequestHandlerBase org.apache.solr.common.SolrException: java.lang.NullPointerException

item.summary: LTR FieldLengthFeature causes NullPointerException with documents that do not have the requested field

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Can i pick this one, first to investigate and reproduce it and then to solve it.

 

Regards,

Ruchir
You can totally pick that one. Go all crazy

I've been investigating a similar issue, although not in the context of dynamic fields. I noticed that a regular, non-dynamic field could lead to NullPointerException as well if it's non-stored (this could be easily reproduced by setting title/description fields from test-files schema as non-stored). Needless to say, FieldLengthFeature should still work with non-stored fields as long as they have norms (and even if they don't things should not break with NPE).

I debugged the issue and it seems that the culprit of both problems (missing dynamic field or and non-stored field) is this searcher.doc(0).getField(field) line in FieldLengthFeatureScorer constructor, which returns null for non-stored and missing fields.

Honestly, I don't understand why FieldLengthFeatureScorer even checks whether the field omits norms or not. I also don't understand why this class is public. It's only used in FieldLengthFeature#scorer and this method already checks whether norms are there or not (and if they are missing a constant 0 ValueFeatureScorer is returned).

I can provide a fix for that.

Commit d9acc079af26bcbb6e9b2502fd61d8de9cee4572 in solr's branch refs/heads/main from Tomasz Elendt
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=solr.git;h=d9acc079af2 ]

SOLR-13219: Fix NPE in FieldLengthFeature with non-stored/missing fields (#1051)

This commit removes unnecessary check for omitNorm from
FieldLengthFeatureScorer that otherwise causes NullPointerException
in FieldLengthFeature for non-stored or missing fields.

Commit 3bec25b57d6fbbba05f6d58bba93efcac86763b9 in solr's branch refs/heads/branch_9x from Tomasz Elendt
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=solr.git;h=3bec25b57d6 ]

SOLR-13219: Fix NPE in FieldLengthFeature with non-stored/missing fields (#1051)

This commit removes unnecessary check for omitNorm from
FieldLengthFeatureScorer that otherwise causes NullPointerException
in FieldLengthFeature for non-stored or missing fields.

(cherry picked from commit d9acc079af26bcbb6e9b2502fd61d8de9cee4572)

(cherry picked from commit d9acc079af26bcbb6e9b2502fd61d8de9cee4572)
